motions.title: Motion to Remove Item #17 from Agenda
motions.description: Motion to remove item #17 (Park Master Plans for 5435 Roberts Drive and 4809/4819 Vermack Road) from agenda and bring back at future date.

motions.title: Consent Agenda Approval
motions.description: Approval of consent agenda including: • January 24, 2022, City Council meeting minutes • January 31, 2022, City Council special called meeting minutes • Resolution appointing a member to serve on the Planning Commission • Approval of additional Human Resources position funded by CARES II

motions.title: Amendment to Add Condition #12 for RZ 21-02
motions.description: Amendment to add condition #12 requiring owner to provide appropriate landscaping approved by staff for gateway sign.

motions.title: Approval of RZ 21-02: Rezoning for 11 Ravinia Drive as Amended
motions.description: Approval of RZ 21-02 rezoning for 11 Ravinia Drive to amend conditions of current PC-2c District to allow furniture retail showroom and concurrent variance, as amended.

motions.title: Approval of Replacement of Taser X2's with Purchase of Taser 7's
motions.description: Approval of purchase of 64 Taser 7s from Axon Enterprises, Inc. for total cost of $230,404.73.

motions.title: Approval of Create Dunwoody Alliance
motions.description: Approval of formation of Create Dunwoody Alliance with annual funding not to exceed $35,000 funded from CARES II Budget for 2022. Five-year $175,000 investment from Development Authority contingent on equal participation from Discover Dunwoody and City.

motions.title: Approval of Updated Al Fresco Grant
motions.description: Approval of updated Al Fresco Grant program keeping small business portion and adding new category for property owners investing in multiple tenants in same retail center. Financial match $1 to $1 for small businesses and $3 to $1 for larger companies.

motions.title: Approval of CARES 2 Amendment
motions.description: Approval of CARES 2 amendment allocating remaining $105,000: $35,000 for arts seed funding, $6,175 for hazard pay, and $63,825 to city supplies and services.

motions.title: Approval of Agreement with Sherrod & Bernard, P.C. for City Attorney Services
motions.description: Approval of agreement between City of Dunwoody and Sherrod & Bernard, P.C. for appointment as city attorney and professional legal services.

motions.title: Motion to Enter Executive Session
motions.description: Motion to enter executive session for the purpose of legal, real estate, and personnel discussion.

publicHearings.title: RZ 21-03: Rezoning for 600 Ashwood Parkway (First Read)
publicHearings.description: First read of rezoning for 600 Ashwood Parkway to amend conditions of current C-1c District to allow 8,400 SF retail/restaurant building on 15 acres in Perimeter Center Marketplace. Proposal includes 62 parking spaces, walk-up ATM, and two outdoor patios. No public comments for or against.

discussionItems.title: Resolution for Budget Amendment for Fiscal Year 2021
Additional Funding for Mount Vernon Place Sidewalk Project
discussionItems.description: Request for additional funding of $14,148.14 under Autaco's unit price contract to cover actual cost of construction for Mount Vernon Place sidewalk project.

discussionItems.title: Contract Amendment with Blount Construction for 2022 Pavement Resurfacing
discussionItems.description: Fifth and final year renewal of Blount Construction's pavement resurfacing contract for $2,752,922 plus 10% contingency. Funded by $2,750,000 SPLOST and $441,005 LMIG funds.

discussionItems.title: Vermack Road Shared-Use Path Adjacent to Dunwoody High School
discussionItems.description: Staff recommended against replacing existing on-street parking with angled parking. Council agreed noting safety concerns and favored 12' path along Vermack.

discussionItems.title: I-285 Issues
discussionItems.description: Staff seeking guidance on Top End I-285 managed lanes project. Council added requests: direct access to Peachtree Industrial Boulevard, Mount Vernon Road managed lane access at State Route 400, Johnson Ferry Road inclusion, managed lane interchange on I-285, and shared use path connections at North Shallowford Road and North Peachtree Road.

notes: Council Member Seconder joined meeting at 8:32 p.m.
